title: Drawing, "Silver Serving Pieces", 1800–25
medium:
Pen and gray ink, gray wash, graphite, ruled borders in pen and black
Support: white laid paper
inscribed: signed in pen and gray ink, lower left: Belli disegne Argentiere; in pen and black ink, top left corner: N 2.
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Silver Serving Pieces", 1800–25.
1800–25. Pen and gray ink, gray wash, graphite, ruled borders in pen and black
